alert.note: Alert for Charles City; Dinwiddie; Prince George; Southampton; Sussex (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 22 at 2:37PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Charles City, central Southampton, Prince George, Sussex, eastern Dinwiddie and western Surry Counties and the City of Petersburg through 315 PM EDT... At 237 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Sedley to 9 miles southeast of Sussex to near Green Plain. Movement was north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small trees and blow around unsecured objects. Wind impacting handling of high profile vehicles. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Sussex, Jarratt and Ivor around 250 PM EDT. Homeville around 255 PM EDT. Wakefield around 300 PM EDT. Stony Creek around 305 PM EDT. Waverly and Dendron around 310 PM EDT. Disputanta, Carson and Cabin Point around 315 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Vicksville, Taylors Corner, Booth Fork, Adams Grove, Carsley, Grizzard, Birchett Estate, Addison, Booker and Yale. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Charles City; Dinwiddie; Prince George; Southampton; Sussex
